com.ibm.ecm.api.coresdk.model

Interface IBMECMDesktop

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<IBMECMBaseObject>, IBMECMBaseObject, Serializable

    public interface IBMECMDesktop
extends IBMECMBaseObject
    Represents an IBM Content Navigator desktop that the current application is accessing. It is usually the second level object after the IBMECMApplication object.

    An application can have many desktops and only one default desktop. Typically an application accesses one desktop at a time.

    A desktop object manages lists of favorites, repositories, synced items, and other items. It also contains information about server connections and user information. For each desktop, it will also have one default repository.

    A desktop must be loaded before it can be used by calling IBMECMApplication.loadCurrentDesktop(IBMECMCompletionHandler)

    • Method Detail

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Returns whether this desktop has been authenticated and connected.
        Returns:
        true if this desktop has been authenticated and connected. The value is false until a login is performed.

      • getUserId

        String getUserId()
        Returns the id of the user that is connected to this desktop.
        Returns:
        the id of the user that is connected to this desktop. The value is null until a login is performed.

      • getUserDisplayName

        String getUserDisplayName()
        Returns the display name of the user that is connected to this desktop.
        Returns:
        the display name of the user that is connected to this desktop. The value is null until a login is performed.

      • isSyncServerEnabled

        boolean isSyncServerEnabled()
        Returns whether the sync server is enabled for this desktop.
        Returns:
        true if the sync server is enabled for this desktop

      • getRepositories

        IBMECMRepository[] getRepositories()
        Returns an array of repositories that this desktop is managing.
        Returns:
        an array of IBMECMRepository objects that this desktop is managing.

      • getDefaultRepository

        IBMECMRepository getDefaultRepository()
        Returns the default repository that is set for this desktop.
        Returns:
        the default IBMECMRepository object that is set for this desktop.

      • getSecurityToken

        String getSecurityToken()
        Returns the security token for the desktop.

        If you make custom requests to the IBM Content Navigator server, you must append the security token on every request. Without the security token, your request will be rejected with an error. The request parameter's name is "securityToken".

        Returns:
        the security token for the desktop

      • getServerVersion

        String getServerVersion()
        Returns the version number for IBM Content Navigator. The version is typically in some form of dot notation with the fix pack version number appended to it.
        Returns:
        the version number for IBM Content Navigator

      • isMobileApplicationEnabled

        boolean isMobileApplicationEnabled()
        Returns whether mobile application access is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if mobile application access is enabled

        Returns whether adding a photo from a mobile application is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if adding a photo from a mobile application is enabled

        boolean isAddDocFoldersToRepositoryFromMobileEnabled()
        Returns whether the mobile application can add document folders to a repository.
        Returns:
        true if the mobile application can add document folders to a repository

        Returns whether the mobile application can open a document from another application.
        Returns:
        true if the mobile application can open a document from another application

      • getMobileAdminEmailAddress

        String getMobileAdminEmailAddress()
        Returns the mobile administrator's support email address. This field can be used to automatically populate the mobile client with a custom support email address.
        Returns:
        the mobile administrator's support email address

      • getFavorites

        List<IBMECMFavorite> getFavorites()
        Returns a unmodifiable list of all the favorites defined in this desktop for the current user. This is null until the retrieveFavorites() call is made.
        Returns:
        a list of IBMECMFavorite objects defined in this desktop

      • isServerVersionSupported

        boolean isServerVersionSupported()
        Returns whether the version of the IBM Content Navigator server is supported for this SDK.
        Returns:
        true if the version of the server is supported for this SDK

      • isMobileAccessAllowed

        boolean isMobileAccessAllowed()
        Returns whether the current desktop allows mobile access.
        Returns:
        true if the current desktop allows mobile access

      • retrieveFavorites

        void retrieveFavorites(IBMECMCompletionHandler<IBMECMResultSet<IBMECMFavorite>> onComplete)
        Retrieves all the favorites defined in this desktop for the current user.
        Parameters:
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns a list of IBMECMFavorite objects if the call is successful
        See Also:
        IBMECMFavorite

      • retrieveFavorites

        IBMECMResultSet<IBMECMFavorite> retrieveFavorites()
        Synchronously retrieves all the favorites defined in this desktop for the current user.
        Returns:
        a result set of IBMECMFavorite objects

      • removeFromFavorites

        void removeFromFavorites(IBMECMFavorite[] favoritesToBeRemoved,
                         IBMECMCompletionHandler<Boolean> onComplete)
        Removes an array of IBMECMFavorite objects for the current user.
        Parameters:
        favoritesToBeRemoved - the array of favorites to remove
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns true if all the favorites were removed

      • retrieveSyncItems

        void retrieveSyncItems(IBMECMCompletionHandler<IBMECMResultSet<IBMECMSyncItem>> onComplete)
        Retrieves all sync items defined in this desktop for the current user.

        An item is added to this server-side list by calling enableSync(IBMECMItem[], IBMECMCompletionHandler).

        Parameters:
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns a result set of all the synced items if the call is successful

      • retrieveSyncItems

        IBMECMResultSet<IBMECMSyncItem> retrieveSyncItems()
        Synchronously retrieves all sync items defined in this desktop for the current user.
        Returns:
        a IBMECMResultSet of IBMECMSyncItem

      • enableSync

        void enableSync(IBMECMItem[] itemsToSync,
                IBMECMCompletionHandler<List<IBMECMSyncItem>> onComplete)
        Enables sync for for the provided items. This method adds the provided items to the server-side list of sync items for this desktop.

        A registered sync client can look at the server-side list and determine which sync item it wants to sync.

        Parameters:
        itemsToSync - the items to enable sync on
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns the list of items synced if the call is successful

      • disableSync

        void disableSync(IBMECMItem[] itemsToDisableSync,
                 IBMECMCompletionHandler<Boolean> onComplete)
        Disables sync for the provided items. This method removes the provided items from the server-side list of sync items for this desktop.
        Parameters:
        itemsToDisableSync - the items to disable sync on
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns true if sync was disabled

      • registerSyncItemsForDevice

        void registerSyncItemsForDevice(IBMECMSyncItem[] syncItems,
                                String deviceId,
                                IBMECMCompletionHandler<List<IBMECMSyncItem>> onComplete)
        Registers an array of IBMECMSyncItem objects for this device or sync client to receive notifications and to also start syncing these items.

        Each device or sync client can choose each sync item out of the server-side list to start syncing.

        To enable an item for syncing and to be added to the server-side list, call enableSync(IBMECMItem[], IBMECMCompletionHandler).

        To retrieve all sync items from the server-side list, call retrieveSyncItems().

        Parameters:
        syncItems - the sync items to register for the current device
        deviceId - the device id for the current device
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns all the sync items that were registered for this device

      • registerSyncItemsForDevice

        List<IBMECMSyncItem> registerSyncItemsForDevice(IBMECMSyncItem[] syncItems,
                                                String deviceId)
        Registers an array of IBMECMSyncItem objects for this device or sync client to receive notifications and to also start syncing these items.

        Each device or sync client can choose each sync item out of the server-side list to start syncing.

        To enable an item for syncing and to be added to the server-side list, call enableSync(IBMECMItem[], IBMECMCompletionHandler).

        To retrieve all sync items from the server-side list, call retrieveSyncItems().

        Parameters:
        syncItems - the sync items to register for the current device
        deviceId - the device id for the current device
        Returns:
        the sync items registered to specific device

      • unregisterSyncItemsForDevice

        void unregisterSyncItemsForDevice(IBMECMSyncItem[] syncItems,
                                  String deviceId,
                                  IBMECMCompletionHandler<List<IBMECMSyncItem>> onComplete)
        Unregisters an array of IBMECMSyncItem for this device to stop receiving notifications and to disable syncing these items for this device.
        Parameters:
        syncItems - the sync items to unregister for the current device
        deviceId - the device id for the current device
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns all the sync items that were unregistered for this device

      • getCookieManager

        CookieManager getCookieManager()
        Returns the CookieManager set for this desktop. The cookies set for this desktop will typically match the cookies in the default repository.
        Returns:
        the CookieManager set for this desktop
